text: Elena Caragiani-Stoenescu Elena Caragiani-Stoenescu (13 May 1887 in Tecuci – 29 March 1929 in Bucharest) was the first woman aviator in Romania.Marcu, George (coord.), Dicţionarul personalităţilor feminine din România, Editura Meronia, București, 2009 Her first flight occurred in 1912, accompanied by her horse riding instructor Mircea Zorileanu, and her no 1591 license was achieved from the International Aeronautical Federation, in 1914, in France. ==Gallery== Image:Elena_caragiani_stoienescu.png|Photocopy of aviator license of Elena Caragiani-Stoenescu, 22 January 1914 Image:Elena_caragiani_stoienescu_portret.png|Portrait Elena Caragiani- Stoenescu == Bibliography == *Firoiu, V., Amazoanele cerului (Sky Amazons), Albatros Publishing House, Bucharest, 1980 ==References== Category:Female aviators Category:Romanian aviators Category:People from Tecuci Category:1929 deaths Category:1887 births Category:Romanian female aviators
title: Elena Caragiani-Stoenescu
